alert.note: Alert for Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 01 at 3:10AM MDT until April 04 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected, with total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible, with total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches possible. Higher amounts possible over the southern Wind River Mountains. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains West. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM this morning to 6 AM MDT Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday evening through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The first round of snow will fall Saturday morning through Sunday morning. A lull of lighter snow will continue to fall Sunday into Sunday evening, before snow rates increase Sunday night/Monday morning and continue through the day Monday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
